intent: Refactor an existing Git CLI wrapper to support interactive staging and pluggable merge strategies while preserving full backward compatibility with existing automation scripts.
constraints: Must not break existing shell scripts relying on current CLI interface
No external dependencies beyond Python 3.8 standard library
decisions: Using Click framework for CLI abstraction (not argparse)
Merge strategies implemented as plugins under plugins/ directory
state_summary: Core CLI migrated to Click. Status, commit, and push commands operational. Interactive staging supports file-level selection but lacks hunk-level granularity. Plugin architecture defined but dynamic loading not implemented. Backward compatibility validated against existing integration scripts.
